now on its homeward voyage from Archangel; more fortunate than I, who may not see my native land, perhaps, for many years. I am, however, in good spirits: my

firm of purpose; nor do the floating sheets of ice that continually pass us, indi<pb xml:id="F1818_v1_031" n="019"/>cating the dangers of the region towards which we are advancing, appear to dismay them. We have already reached a very high latitude; but it is the height of summer, and although not so warm as in England, the southern gales, which blow us speedily towards those shores which I so ardently desire to attain, breathe a degree of renovating warmth which I had not expected.

rdgGrp.n: ['the appearance of the sky is indiscribably beautiful; clear by day, and illuminated at night by the aurora borealis <del-inner rend="strikethrough">w</del-inner> which spreads a roseate tinge over the heavens, and over the sea which reflects it’s splendour.', '<p-end/>', '<p-start/>', 'no', 'incidents', 'have', 'hitherto', 'befallen']
rdgGrp.rdg:
The appearance of the sky is indiscribably beautiful; clear by day, and illuminated at night by the Aurora Borealis w which spreads a roseate tinge over the heavens, & over the sea which reflects it’s splendour.

No incidents have hitherto befallen
that would make a figure in a letter. One or two
that would make a figure in a letter. One or two

I will not rashly encounter danger. I will be cool, persevering, and prudent.
I will not rashly encounter danger. I will be cool, persevering, and prudent.

I will not rashly encounter danger. I will be cool, persevering, and prudent.

rdgGrp.n: ['but success shall crown my endeavours. wherefore not? thus far i have gone, tracing a secure way over the pathless seas: the very stars themselves being witnesses and testimonies of my triumph. why not still proceed over the untamed yet obedient element? what can stop the determined heart and resolved will of man?', '<p-end/>', '<p-start/>']
rdgGrp.rdg: But success shall crown my endeavours. Wherefore not? Thus far I have gone, tracing a secure way over the pathless seas: the very stars themselves being witnesses and testimonies of my triumph. Why not still proceed over the untamed yet obedient element? What can stop the determined heart and resolved will of man?

English friends.

Most affectionately yours,

English friends.

Most affectionately yours,

English friends.

Most affectionately yours,
swelling heart involuntarily pours itself out thus. But I must finish. Heaven bless my beloved sister!
